message.text: currently the ribbon menu is on page top move it to the left side.

parts.text: currently the ribbon menu is on page top move it to the left side.

response.value:
To move the `<app-ribbonmenu>` from the top to the left side, you need to:

1. Update the HTML structure to create a sidebar layout.
2. Adjust CSS to make the sidebar vertical and content area fill the rest.

Here's a suggested change for your

:

````html

Ready
```` **Notes:** - The sidebar is always visible if `isSupportedBrowser` is true. - The main content area is flexible and scrollable. - You may want to move the sidebar logic into a CSS class for maintainability. - Adjust the sidebar width and background as needed. You may also need to update your CSS to further style the sidebar and content area. Let me know if you want the CSS as well!

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

message.text: the left side menu and content is not alligned properly solve it

parts.text: the left side menu and content is not alligned properly solve it

response.value:
To properly align the left menu and content, you should:

- Use a flex container for the main layout (sidebar + content).
- Remove the outer `<perfect-scrollbar>` that wraps both sidebar and content.
- Place the sidebar and content as siblings inside a flex container.
- Let the content area handle its own scrolling.

Here’s how you can update your code:

````html

Ready
```` **Key changes:** - The main flex container (`display: flex; flex-direction: column; height: 100vh;`) wraps everything. - When logged in, sidebar and content are siblings in a horizontal flex row. - The content area uses its own `` for scrolling. - `min-width: 0; min-height: 0;` ensures proper flexbox shrinking and scrolling. This will align your sidebar and content correctly and make the layout responsive. You may want to move inline styles to CSS for maintainability.

codeBlocks.code: Ready
codeBlocks.markdownBeforeBlock:
To properly align the left menu and content, you should:

- Use a flex container for the main layout (sidebar + content).
- Remove the outer `<perfect-scrollbar>` that wraps both sidebar and content.
- Place the sidebar and content as siblings inside a flex container.
- Let the content area handle its own scrolling.

Here’s how you can update your code:

parts.text: align header at top, ribbon menu on left side and maibn content in right

message.text: align header at top, ribbon menu on left side and maibn content in right

response.value:
To align the header at the top, the ribbon menu on the left, and the main content on the right, you need a layout like this:

- **Header**: full width at the top
- **Below header**: a flex row with sidebar (ribbon menu) and main content

Here’s how to update your

:

````html

Ready
```` **Key points:** - The header is always at the top. - The main area is a flex row: sidebar on the left, content on the right. - The sidebar and content fill the space below the header. - Use `height: 100vh` and `flex: 1` to ensure proper stretching and scrolling. Move inline styles to CSS for maintainability if needed.

• {{appUser.nameInitials }}

```` **Add to your header.component.css for alignment:** ````css /* ...existing code... */ .header-content { display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: space-between; } .header-left { display: flex; align-items: center; } .header-menu { display: flex; align-items: center; list-style: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; } .header-menu li { margin-left: 18px; } ```` This will align the logo to the left and the menu to the right in your header.

message.text: align the menu in a way - image and in next line title of the menu

response.value: ````html

• Organizations
  • Individuals
  • OEM Supplied
  • All Users
  • Products Management
  • Delete Upgrade To ENT Users
```` **Add to your ribbonmenu.component.css:** ````css /* ...existing code... */ .vertical-menu { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; } .vertical-link { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; text-align: center; padding: 16px 0 8px 0; } .menu-icon { display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; } .menu-title { margin-top: 6px; font-size: 13px; font-weight: 500; color: #333; word-break: break-word; } ```` This will stack the icon above the menu title for each menu item and center them vertically.
